t: John 14
Let*rp not*r your*r heart*r be*r troubled:*r ye*r believe*r in*r God,*r believe*r also*r in*r me.*r

And*rp if*r I*r go*r and*r prepare*r a*r place*r for*r you,*r I*r will*r come*r again,*r and*r receive*r you*r unto*r myself;*r that*r where*r I*r am,*r there*r ye*r may*r be*r also.*r
And*rp whither*r I*r go*r ye*r know,*r and*r the*r way*r ye*r know.*r
Thomas*p saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?
Jesus*p saith unto him, I*r am*r the*r way,*r the*r truth,*r and*r the*r life:*r no*r man*r cometh*r unto*r the*r Father,*r but*r by*r me.*r
If*rp ye*r had*r known*r me,*r ye*r should*r have*r known*r my*r Father*r also:*r and*r from*r henceforth*r ye*r know*r him,*r and*r have*r seen*r him.*r
Philip*p saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

Jesus*p saith unto him, Have*r I*r been*r so*r long*r time*r with*r you,*r and*r yet*r hast*r thou*r not*r known*r me,*r Philip?*r he*r that*r hath*r seen*r me*r hath*r seen*r the*r Father;*r and*r how*r sayest*r thou*r then,*r Shew*r us*r the*r Father?*r

Believe*rp me*r that*r I*r am*r in*r the*r Father,*r and*r the*r Father*r in*r me:*r or*r else*r believe*r me*r for*r the*r very*r works'*r sake.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r He*r that*r believeth*r on*r me,*r the*r works*r that*r I*r do*r shall*r he*r do*r also;*r and*r greater*r works*r than*r these*r shall*r he*r do;*r because*r I*r go*r unto*r my*r Father.*r
And*rp whatsoever*r ye*r shall*r ask*r in*r my*r name,*r that*r will*r I*r do,*r that*r the*r Father*r may*r be*r glorified*r in*r the*r Son.*r
If*rp ye*r shall*r ask*r any*r thing*r in*r my*r name,*r I*r will*r do*r it.*r
If*rp ye*r love*r me,*r keep*r my*r commandments.*r
And*rp I*r will*r pray*r the*r Father,*r and*r he*r shall*r give*r you*r another*r Comforter,*r that*r he*r may*r abide*r with*r you*r for*r ever;*r

Even*rp the*r Spirit*r of*r truth;*r whom*r the*r world*r cannot*r receive,*r because*r it*r seeth*r him*r not,*r neither*r knoweth*r him:*r but*r ye*r know*r him;*r for*r he*r dwelleth*r with*r you,*r and*r shall*r be*r in*r you.*r

Judas*p saith unto him, not Iscariot, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?

Jesus*p answered and said unto him, If*r a*r man*r love*r me,*r he*r will*r keep*r my*r words:*r and*r my*r Father*r will*r love*r him,*r and*r we*r will*r come*r unto*r him,*r and*r make*r our*r abode*r with*r him.*r

These*rp things*r have*r I*r spoken*r unto*r you,*r being*r yet*r present*r with*r you.*r
